result.execSummary:
The defendant Sean E Mathews was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Count 3 and any other sentence.
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for August 26, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

miscConds.notes:
- Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
- Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.
- Restitution is set at zero.

- No contact with firearms.

48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
- NO CONTACT with Danielle M., Deshawn M. or Shawn M., UNLESS requested by victim and then only with prior approval of agent.

- Attend and successfully complete Batterers Intervention and continued programming.
- Mental health evaluation and take all prescribed medication(s), and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
- Parenting classes.
- Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
- AODA and recommended treatment; maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

timeConds.notes: - Serve 180 days in the House of Correction STAYED pending a review on 8/26/16 at 1:30 pm in Branch 45.

records.addlTxt: Transcript SENTENCING HEARING, commencing MAY 13, 2016, received and filed.  Original transcript in case file 15CF2428 (34 Pages).
Per email from Probation Dept., defendant's probation has been or is in the process of being revoked.  Review hearing is cancelled.

16A 016914
Re-applied money to both counts after count 3 assessments were not yet entered into CCAP when money was originally applied.

Defendant Sean E Mathews in court with attorney Russell J. A. Jones.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for sentencing hearing.    State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.  Negotiations placed on the record by the state.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the state, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Danielle M. and Michael Barber.

AS TO COUNT 1: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction; consecutive to Count 3 and any other sentence.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 3 YEARS.

AS TO COUNT 3: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction; consecutive to Count 1 and any other sentence.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 3 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Serve 180 days in the House of Correction STAYED pending a review on 8/26/16 at 1:30 pm in Branch 45.
- Attend and successfully complete Batterers Intervention and continued programming.
- Mental health evaluation and take all prescribed medication(s), and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
- AODA and recommended treatment; maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
- Parenting classes.
- Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
- NO CONTACT with Danielle M., Deshawn M. or Shawn M., UNLESS requested by victim and then only with prior approval of agent.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
- Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.
- Restitution is set at zero.

48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
The defendant is advised of appeal rights.

RECEIVED & FILED: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement; Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for August 26, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Sean E Mathews in court with attorney Russell J. A. Jones.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Sentencing began. Due to reasons placed on the record, court ordered case adjourned for Sentencing. Case adjourned to branch 24.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
PSI received and filed.

Defendant Sean E Mathews in court with attorney Russell J. A. Jones.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Case set for Jury Trial. Parties have reached a resolution. 

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 3
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

AS TO COUNT 2
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on motion of the state, court ordered count 2 Dismissed, But Read In. 

Defense requests a PSI without recommendation. Court ordered PSI without recommendation.   

Case adjourned to branch 24 for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 28, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed, Justice Point Report.

Recalled at 3:45
Defendant Sean E Mathews in court.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 40 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
